content:
Hello, looking to upgrade from 4.9 to 5.x and the docs [https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/upgrade-or-modify.html#upgrading-to-a-release] don't seam to get me there using the top steps.
Is there another place I should be looking?
I tried a search and didn't seam to find what I was looking for. Sorry if I missed something I should have seen.
@Tyson Parker yeah, that's because 5.0 isn't released yet (we're working on it!); use upgrade-zulip-from-git main.
Thanks Tim. Will do this on dev first! Running debian 10.11 and 4.9 zulip. Will see where that gets me

Reading logs this appears to be the only thing I see wacky:
WARNING: You are using pip version 20.3.4; however, version 22.0.3 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the '/srv/zulip-venv-cache/a4194fa3043b76bc764373c54635b10e6b325b85/zulip-py3-venv/bin/python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip' command.

Otherwise it seams to have installed. Will do some basic user testing.
Thanks!
Tyson Parker has marked this topic as resolved.
FYI, in regards to the pip warning. I ran a second update to test what would happen if I updated prior to the update, it downgraded it then gave the warning again?
Hmm, @Anders Kaseorg should we be updating that pip version pin for 5.0?
We canâ€™t upgrade Pip until https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/5780 is resolved.
OK, thanks for confirming; I had a vague recollection there was an impediment of that form.
